Parameter.Label: Motion Sensor Sensitivity
Parameter.Help: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. Available settings: 8 - 255 ￼￼￼1. MO [byte]

Parameter.Label: Motion Sensor Blind Time
Parameter.Help: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6. Available settings: 0 - 15 Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1)

Parameter.Label: PIR Sensor Pulse Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings. Available settings: 0 - 3 Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1)

Parameter.Label: PIR Sensor Window Time
Parameter.Help: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings. Available settings: 0 - 3 Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1)

Parameter.Label: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay
Parameter.Help: Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”). Available settings: 1 - 65535

PIR sensor active during the night only

Parameter.Label: PIR Sensor Operating Mode
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings.

Parameter.Label: NIGHT / DAY
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.

Only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

Parameter.Label: BASIC COMMAND CLASS FRAMES CONFIGURATION
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters.

Parameter.Label: BASIC ON command frame value
Parameter.Help: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.

Parameter.Label: BASIC OFF command frame value
Parameter.Help: The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.

Parameter.Label: TAMPER SENSITIVITY
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the chages in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm beig reported - g-force acceleration. Available settigs: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive)

Parameter.Label: TAMPER ALARM CANCELLATION DELAY
Parameter.Help: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cacelled. Another tampering detected durig the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.

Parameter.Label: TAMPER OPERATING MODES
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.

Parameter.Label: TAMPER ALARM BROADCAST MODE
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames).

Parameter.Label: ILLUMINATION REPORT THRESHOLD
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.

Parameter.Label: ILLUMINATION REPORTS INTERVAL
Parameter.Help: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.

Parameter.Label: TEMPERATURE REPORT THRESHOLD
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5oC; 0 = reports are not sent)

Parameter.Label: INTERVAL OF TEMPERATURE MEASURING
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured)

Parameter.Label: TEMPERATURE REPORTS INTERVAL
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 sekund; 0 = reports are not sent)

Parameter.Label: TEMPERATURE OFFSET
Parameter.Help: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100oC) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10oC)

Parameter.Label: LED SIGNALING MODE
Parameter.Help: The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected. Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled. Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again. Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again

Parameter.Label: LED BRIGHTNESS
Parameter.Help:
The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)

Parameter.Label: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL BELOW WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 1%
Parameter.Help:

Parameter.Label: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL ABOVE WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 100%
Parameter.Help: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0. Available settings: parameter 82 value to 65535 Default setting: 1 000 (1 000 lux)
